bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lawrence [Walter L.] Reed, July 29, 1941

div1.p: Hench mentions the possible publication of his recent paper. He would like to know what to do about showing his copies of Walter Reed's letters to Laura Wood Roper. Hench, along with Kean and Ireland, are trying to memorialize the true site of Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lawrence [Walter L.] Reed, July 29, 1941
div1.p:
Thank you very kindly for your thoughtful letter of July 15.
I am so glad that your sister was so pleased with the Cleveland affair.
Although it was a small affair it was very impressive.

I appreciate very much your kind words about my paper. I sub-
mitted it to Dr. Fishbein, who wants to publish it in Hygeia and I believe
a black and white or possibly even a colored reproduction of the painting
will be included with the talk. Reprints will be available and I shall
be delighted to send you, your mother and your sister as many reprints as
you would care to have.

Concerning the matter of Miss Wood. Her letters seem very gra-
cious and I am glad to give her such information as I can. I think that
she would get much more information if she were permitted to read your
father's letters which your sister kindly showed me, than she would out
of anything that I have, but until your sister is well enough to see her,
this will have to be left to the future.

I am continuing my efforts to have the true site of Camp Lazear
memorialized. These efforts have been delayed somewhat because of the
great press of work here during the summer months. I hope to acquaint
you with these efforts in more detail and Generals Kean and Ireland have
promised to help me with this matter also.

I have been invited to speak before the American Academy of
Orthopedic Surgeons which meets in Washington in January and if I cannot
get there before that I sincerely hope to have the privilege of meeting
you then.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. Major General Walter L. Reed
2810 Thirty-sixth Place
Washington, D. C.
